title: Geotagging on Flickr, viewing on Google Earth
body: <p>Not too long ago <a title="Ern" href="http://ern.hopto.org/blog">Ern</a> pointed out to me that I had an <a href="http://flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/16029763/#comment4460275" title="MM0 on Rt 1">image</a> that should be <a href="http://geobloggers.com/about.cfm" title="geotagged, geo:lat=xxx.xxxx and geo:lon=xxx.xxxx">geotagged</a>. <a href="http://www.geobloggers.com/" title="the map _is_ the territory">GeoBloggers'</a> integration with <a href="http://maps.google.com/" title="best map site ever">Google Maps</a> was pretty sweet (especially since it was pre-API). I even <a href="http://flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/16029763/#comment4460275" title="javascript, yay">modified a bookmarklet to make grabbing the GPS coords easier</a>. I thought it was kind of a neat concept and tagged a few more of my photos with their GPS coordinates.</p><p>Then <a href="http://earth.google.com/" title="even better than google maps">Google Earth</a> came out. I had loved <a href="http://www.keyhole.com/body.php?h=products" title="was nice, trial period sucked">Keyhole</a>, and almost bought it several times so I was eager to see what new and cool features Google would add to their free version. It still has a somewhat quirky java-esque interface, but it is an amazing app. Of course being as leet as they are, those crazy geobloggers had a <a href="http://flickr.com/groups/topic/49042/#comment362660" title="KML actually">custom XML file</a> all ready to go to import into Google Earth. A simple right-click under My Places, add network link, paste in your <a href="http://www.geobloggers.com/makeXML.cfm?action=search&amp;range=-180,-85.98213689652795,180,86.17445430768888&amp;iMaxRecords=50&amp;iStartRecord=1&amp;mode=googleEarth&amp;sUsername=T-Rav" title="T-Rav's Photos (copy/paste into google earth network link)">geobloggers XML url</a>, and whammy blammy wowie zowie all your geotagged Flickr images are now in Google Earth. Needless to say I've been uploading and <a href="http://flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/tags/geotagged/" title="Flickr: T-Rav's photos tagged with geotagged">geotagging photos</a> of what I thought to be a landmark (or geotaggable in some way) like mad for the past few days.</p><p>(apparently, I'm not the only one who <a href="http://flickr.com/photos/steeev/24522903/">thinks this is cool either</a>)</p>
bodyArticleHtml:
2005-07-08

Geotagging on Flickr, viewing on Google Earth

Not too long ago
T-Rav's Photos (copy/paste into google earth network link)
Flickr: T-Rav's photos tagged with geotagged
